currentDoc:
Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For what

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one.

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do.

If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue f

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this wor

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm t

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be i

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do.

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always go

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is hel

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an ani

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one.

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong. 

Human beings

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong. 

Human beings love things that we

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong. 

Human beings love things that we can take care of. That includes our fa

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong. 

Human beings love things that we can take care of. That includes our family, our friends

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong. 

Human beings love things that we can take care of. That includes our family, our friends and our animals. W

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong. 

Human beings love things that we can take care of. That includes our family, our friends and our animals. We also love things

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one.

There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong. 

Human beings love things that we can take care of. That includes our family, our friends and our animals. We also love things that love us back a

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong. 

Human beings love things that we can take care of. That includes our family, our friends and our animals. We also love things that love us back and once again o

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong. 

Human beings love things that we can take care of. That includes our family, our friends and our animals. We also love things that love us back and once again our friends, famil

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong.

There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong. 

Human beings love things that we can take care of. That includes our family, our friends and our animals. We also love things that love us back and once again our friends, family and animals give us that love back

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong. 

Human beings love things that we can take care of. That includes our family, our friends and our animals. We also love things that love us back and once again our friends, family and animals give us that love back.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong. 

Human beings love things that we can take care of. That includes our family, our friends and our animals. We also love things that love us back and once again our friends, family and animals give us that love back. We have an emotio

He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

We also love things that love us back and once again our friends, family and animals give us that love back. We have an emotional bond and a strong connection with them that can't be replaced. 

A

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong. 

Human beings love things that we can take care of. That includes our family, our friends and our animals. We also love things that love us back and once again our friends, family and animals give us that love back. We have an emotional bond and a strong connection with them that can't be replaced.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong. 

Human beings love things that we can take care of. That includes our family, our friends and our animals. We also love things that love us back and once again our friends, family and animals give us that love back. We have an emotional bond and a strong connection with them that can't be replaced.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one.

There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong. 

Human beings love things that we can take care of. That includes our family, our friends and our animals. We also love things that love us back and once again our friends, family and animals give us that love back. We have an emotional bond and a strong connection with them that can't be replaced. 

As humans we can care about humans and animals at the

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong. 

Human beings love things that we can take care of. That includes our family, our friends and our animals. We also love things that love us back and once again our friends, family and animals give us that love back. We have an emotional bond and a strong connection with them that can't be replaced. 

As humans we can care about humans and animals at the same time. THat i

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong. 

Human beings love things that we can take care of. That includes our family, our friends and our animals. We also love things that love us back and once again our friends, family and animals give us that love back. We have an emotional bond and a strong connection with them that can't be replaced. 

As humans we can care about humans and animals at the same time. That is what

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong. 

Human beings love things that we can take care of. That includes our family, our friends and our animals. We also love things that love us back and once again our friends, family and animals give us that love back. We have an emotional bond and a strong connection with them that can't be replaced. 

As humans we can care about humans and animals at the same time. That is what I have done my ent

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, I am not surprised at all that humans have empathy for animals compared to strangers. Most of us who have pets consider animals to be part of our family. If an animal is getting beaten, it doesn't really have a way to defend itself. A human has the ability to defend itself and to fight back. Humans are stronger and more powerful than most animals so it would be disgusting to harm one. 

I also don't think it has to be a black and white issue. We should care about both humans suffering as well as an animal's welfare. For whatever reason, we as humans just love dogs. I love my dog. He is the best dog in the world in my opinion. I consider him to be my family. And I'm not sure why I feel that way, I just do. 

I want to do everything I can to stop animal cruelty and I also want to do everything I can to prevent humans from suffering. The problem is no matter how hard we try, it will be impossible to eradicate either issue from our world. There are always going to be bad human beings in this world that like to cause harm to both people and animals. Those people absolutely disgust me and should be in jail.

Think about how many people are murdered each day. Think about how many people are robbed at gunpoint. Think about how many animals are just dropped off on the side of the road. A bunch of people are heartless and have no conscience. There is always going to be evil in this world sadly.

What us good people can do is help our fellow man and give love and care to our animals. We also can say something if we see something. If I see a person or an animal being mistreated, I'm going to step in every time and try to correct that wrong. 

Human beings love things that we can take care of. That includes our family, our friends and our animals. We also love things that love us back and once again our friends, family and animals give us that love back. We have an emotional bond and a strong connection with them that can't be replaced. 

As humans we can care about humans and animals at the same time. That is what I have done my entire life and that is not going to c
